a5962042-7cc7-4cab-bdbb-6f6acff73682.description: Earners who have achieved certification in HCQM are deeply committed to patient safety, health care quality, and effective care. Those certified in HCQM demonstrate their superior ability to critically evaluate industry literature, identify evidence-based best practices, and make recommendations that balance appropriateness of health care services with cost and quality. HCQM Board Certification addresses the need for effectiveness, efficiency, equity, safety, and timeliness.

badge_template_activities.title: Diplomates earning the CHCQM credential have successfully completed the Health Care Quality and Management Certification Exam.

To qualify for the HCQM Certification Exam, candidates must eligiblity requirements including: complete the HCQM Application process; complete a minimum of 25 hours of HCQM-related education within the past 5 years (or complete the online HCQM Core Body of Knowledge course); provide references; hold a current, unrestricted license in each state they are licensed (as applciable to their profession); and provide documentation of 208 hours of active involvement in the any of the exam categories.

7921922b-61af-47bb-bcba-b473cfed8117.description: Diplomates may further validate their knowledge and experience by achieving Sub-Specialty certification(s) in: Case Management, Managed Care, Patient Safety/Risk Management, Physician Advisor, Transitions of Care, and Workers' Compensation. Sub-Specialty credentials are issued to Diplomates who meet the following requirements: Sub-Specialty application; hold a current, non-restricted license in each state licensed or certified (as applicable to profession); provide documentation of active involvement (312 hours) within the last 4 years in Physician Advisor roles; & complete a minimum of 24 hours of ABQAURP-approved continuing education pertinent to Physician Advisor roles & responsiblities (HCQM Core Body of Knowledge hours apply).
